result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Alexandra Mae Weiss in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Alexandra Mae Weiss.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer rec'd; counsel req adj to review w/def.

Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not have violent contact with K.M.H. or K.M.H.'s residence except a one time visit for 20 minutes to obtain personal belongings in the presence of a law enforcement officer.

Clerk BMC; Defendant Alexandra Mae Weiss in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa appeared by video for Alexandra Mae Weiss.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. State requests $500 cash bond. Court orders $500 signature bond. Not guilty plea entered by Court.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
